title: Cloud Cybersecurity DevOps Engineer
description:
Do you have direct experience as a DevOps Engineer within Cloud Infrastructures? Do you have exposure or inrerest in leveraging that knowledge into Cloud Cybersecurity?

If this sounds like you and you are driven by purpose, Join the SOPHiA GENETICS InfoSec and Technology Innovation Team as our new Cloud Cybersecurity Engineer / Senior InfoSec Analyst, and enable us to make a positive impact on the outcomes for cancer and rare disease patients worldwide.

Enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule allowing 2 days PW home working, collaborating closely with tech colleagues in Bidart, France office.

As an international organisation, English is our primary business language and you will need to bring full fluency in English. As part of your recruitment journey, you will meet English-only speaker and CVs should be submitted in English. Non-English CVs have a high likelihood of being rejected at application stage.

Our mission

We believe there is a smarter, more data-driven way to make decisions in healthcare and our cloud-native AI powered SOPHiA DDM Platform makes that vision a reality on a daily basis. You will have direct input to our mission to democratize data-driven medicine for the ultimate benefit of cancer and rare disease patients across the globe.

Your mission

Reporting to the Head of Architecture and Cybersecurity, you will be responsible for ensuring we develop and maintain software products within a secure cloud infrastructure, and drive cybersecurity best practice across our wider internal applications.

The value you add:
‚Ä¢ Identify and troubleshoot potential risks through threat modeling and vulnerability assessments, providing guidance to DevOps or driving hands-on execution to solutions.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating on cloud infrastructure improvements and implementing security controls to monitor compliance across DevOps processes
‚Ä¢ Implement and monitor alerting systems to support certification requirements (I.e. C5 Type 2)
‚Ä¢ Maintain and integrate vulnerability managment tools within DevOps environments such as GitLab, Snyk and SonarQube

Requirements

The value you bring
‚Ä¢ 4+ years direct working experience of DevOps within Cloud Infrastructures (preferably Azure)
‚Ä¢ Exposure to Security Engineering and Cloud Cybersecurity best practices valuable, with working knowledge of security patches/fixes.
‚Ä¢ Certifications in Cloud Architecture or Cybersecurity are valuable, but not mandatory
‚Ä¢ Java & Python are our main languages
‚Ä¢ Partnering with multiple teams, you need to be comfortable communicating clearly and persuasively with stakeholders at all levels, including those without technical knoweldge.
‚Ä¢ This role is not likely to be suitable for someone exclusively from an InfoSec or Cybersecurity Governance and Compliance background. This person must bring hands-on engineering experience to be set for success

Benefits

You will be joining an organisation with the patient at the heart of every decision and action, driven by purpose as we pursue exponential growth.

Business recognition and accolades include:
‚Ä¢ World's most innovative companies (Top 10)
‚Ä¢ World's smartest companies (Top 50)
‚Ä¢ 100 Best Places to Work in Boston
‚Ä¢ Top 10 European Tech Startup
‚Ä¢ Top 10 European biotechs startup to watch
‚Ä¢ Top 25 East-Coast Biotech to watch

Our benefits package is comprehensive, but varies internationally in-line with local standards and laws. You can discuss a full breakdown with us, but as a brief overview:
‚Ä¢ Forfait-Jour working types
‚Ä¢ Health benefits for you and your family covered by 80% employer contributions
‚Ä¢ Life Insurance and pensions contribution
‚Ä¢ SWILE meal vouchers and home office allowances
‚Ä¢ 25 Days Vacation
‚Ä¢ Additional voluntary benefits including sports allowance, language courses, bank partnerships and transportation.

Our DNA

Like the strands of DNA itself, SOPHiA GENETICS and the team are deeply interconnected and reliant on each other to deliver. There are common threads across the team. Things that bind us together. Those things are Relentless Curious; Resilient & Nimble and Fearlessly Adventurous

Our Virtues

At SOPHiA GENETICS we established our 7 Virtues to clarify how our principles show up each day through action. We Decide; We Do; We Collaborate; We Innovate; We Empower; We Adapt and We Learn.

At the centre of our Virtues is our Mantra, We Care, which provides a constant reminder of the compassionate, benevolent, and hopeful nature of our mission and how it should be threaded through each of our Virtues and everything we do. Learn more about our DNA and Virtues on our Careers portal

The Process

We use the power of AI to help our partners make decisions. If you‚Äôre utilising AI in your search and application process, why not use some of these prompts, or read our AI guide.

‚ÄòWhat impact can I expect to have on the world by working at SOPHiA GENETICS?‚Äô

‚ÄòI have an interview with SOPHiA GENETICS. What should I know before I meet with them?‚Äô

‚ÄòI am a *job title* - What can SOPHiA GENETICS offer my career?‚Äô

Apply now with your CV and any supporting information.

Suitably qualified candidates will be invited through an interview and screening process where you will speak with members of our Talent Acquisition Team, the hiring leader alongside key colleagues and stakeholders from across the business. If you need additional support for accessibility, please contact our TA team for assistance.

We appreciate the value external partners can bring, but we operate a direct-hiring model and we are not looking to utilise agency support at this time. All hiring is controlled by Talent Acquisition, potential partners should liaise through TA and not our hiring teams please.

Starting Date: ASAP

Location: Onsite Hybrid (3D PW) Bidart, FR (Preference) Rolle, CH (Possible)

Contract: Permanent, full time

title: DevOps Engineer H/F
description:

Within 3 months, you will

Within 12 months, you will :

The Skill Set

- 3+ years of experience as a DEVOPS Engineer or in a similar role.

What we offer :

- Balance : Flexible hours, Total work from home possible anywhere in Spain

Each group has at least one executive team member serving as a member of the group, bringing greater awareness to each group's activities and providing a quick path to impact
- Corporate Social Responsibility : Review our CSR Charter :
- Culture : A framework that will help you make an impact - envision our way of working and our Convexity Culture : & find out more about the teams, product and processes

Interview Process :

- Phone Screen with our Talent Acquisition Manager
- Discovery Meeting with our Lead DEVOPS
- Case Study to do at home

title: AWS DevOps Engineer
description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.

6+ Years of Experienced with working on deployment, automation, management, and maintenance of AWS cloud-based production system
‚Ä¢ Experienced with ensuring availability, performance, security, and scalability of AWS production systems.
‚Ä¢ Extensive experience with Terraform, Docker, ECS, and EKS for infrastructure automation and container orchestration.
‚Ä¢ Strong hands-on experience with GitLab CI/CD, GitLab Runners, and Git version control.
‚Ä¢ Building and maintaining secure, scalable AWS environments using best practices and AWS KMS for key management.
‚Ä¢ Implementing and managing Lambda, SQS, and SNS for event-driven architecture and microservices communication.
‚Ä¢ Provisioning critical system security using Tenable for vulnerability management and implementing industry-standard compliance
‚Ä¢ Integrating and maintaining SonarQube for static code analysis and enforcing quality gates within CI/CD pipelines
‚Ä¢ Providing architecture and process improvement recommendations for performance and security enhancement (nice to have).
‚Ä¢ Setting up and maintaining observability with tools like Datadog, AWS CloudWatch, and ELK for metrics, logging, and monitoring.
‚Ä¢ Designing and managing tools for automation of operational processes and configuration management.
‚Ä¢ Developing and managing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, optionally CloudFormation or Ansible.
‚Ä¢ Implementing CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery, quality checks, and rollback strategies.
‚Ä¢ Working closely with Development, QA, and Operations teams for collaborative troubleshooting and performance tuning.
‚Ä¢ Managing cloud services efficiently using AWS, and optionally Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
‚Ä¢ Applying security practices and ensuring compliance with internal and external standards.
‚Ä¢ Creating and maintaining documentation for infrastructure, configurations, deployments, and operational procedures. Continuously monitoring, profiling, and optimizing system performance, scalability, and reliability.

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent experience.
‚Ä¢ Certifications: AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, or other relevant certifications.
‚Ä¢ Experience with other Cloud Providers: Familiarity with other cloud platforms such as Azure or Google Cloud is a plus.

Technical Skills
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CICD, Github Actions, CircleCI).
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge In terraform, GitlabCICD, Docker, ECS and EKS
‚Ä¢ Experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of AWS (Lambda, ECS, EKS, EC2, S3, KMS, IAM, RDS, SQS, SNS), familiarity with Azure or GCP.
‚Ä¢ Experience with infrastructure automation tools Terraform (primary), CloudFormation, Ansible.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Benefits

At eligarf Technologies, we transcend the boundaries of conventional IT services, crafting tailor-made solutions that catalyse your business ambitions. With a global footprint, we seamlessly blend innovation and expertise to architect a digital landscape that amplifies your growth trajectory.

Our core ethos revolves around sculpting bespoke services that resonate with your unique business DNA. We don‚Äôt offer mere solutions; we engineer strategies that become an intrinsic part of your success story. From Agile software development and meticulously curated software development to cutting-edge AI & ML and seamless cloud integration, our offerings are a symphony of technology and strategy.

We want enthusiastic people to be part of our family and have an open mind-frame and are willing to experiment with different options and multi-task in different aspects of business. Let us assure you that work will not be easy, but it will be worth it. We are an established company with a start-up mind-set and are looking for members to skip lunches over meetings, brainstorm on ideas on different aspects of business and roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. We want members who want to do something new and different and make a mark in whatever they do. We are not looking for time watching members. We are looking for a member who stays with us through the highs and lows of a dynamic and fast growing organization. You will have enough challenges to grow and enjoy your work. We have an interesting ABCDEF philosophy, which we believe will help you an individual. If you would like to work in this dynamic environment, know more about ABCDEF and contribute to your and the company‚Äôs growth.

If this job description is of your interest, please revert ASAP to move ahead.

For any further queries, feel free to contact.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Tech Soft 3D, the global leader in 3D software development toolkits, is seeking an Senior DevOps Engineer. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be a key contributor to designing, automating, and optimizing infrastructure solutions. You will be responsible for implementing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Azure DevOps, Jenkins, TerraForm, Packer, Ansible, BitBucket, and Git, ensuring high availability, security, and scalability. You will take ownership of complex tasks, proactively solve challenges, and drive continuous improvement in cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines. Additionally, you will mentor and support team members while fostering a collaborative and efficient engineering culture. This position is based in our Lyon, France office with hybrid work schedule flexibility.

What You Will Do:
‚Ä¢ Architect, develop, and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions using Terraform, Ansible, or similar tools.
‚Ä¢ Design and optimize CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps, Jenkins, and other automation platforms.
‚Ä¢ Manage source control systems (BitBucket, Git) and enforce best practices in branching, merging, and version control.
‚Ä¢ Identify, address, and reduce technical debt in infrastructure and automation solutions.
‚Ä¢ Write high-quality, scalable, and maintainable automation scripts (Python, Bash, PowerShell).
‚Ä¢ Ensure security, performance, and reliability in cloud-based environments.
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and resolve CI/CD pipeline issues and infrastructure problems efficiently.
‚Ä¢ Advocate for and enforce best practices in code quality, automation, and DevOps methodologies.
‚Ä¢ Lead technical discussions and design sessions, breaking down large challenges into manageable tasks.
‚Ä¢ Provide mentorship and technical guidance to engineers on DevOps tools, processes, and best practices.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, QA, security, product, and IT teams to align infrastructure goals.
‚Ä¢ Promote documentation, knowledge sharing, and process improvements across the Dev Ops Organization.The

Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of experience in DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or Infrastructure Automation
‚Ä¢ Expertise in Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Ansible, BitBucket, and Git
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar tools
‚Ä¢ Solid experience in scripting languages (Python, Bash, PowerShell, yaml) for automation
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of CI/CD principles, source control management, and deployment best practices
‚Ä¢ Experience working with cloud platforms (Azure, GitHub Actions, AWS/GCP is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of networking, security, monitoring, and performance optimization
‚Ä¢ Ability to navigate, troubleshoot, and optimize large-scale infrastructure architectures
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to mentor others
‚Ä¢ Exposure to multi-platform development (Windows, Linux, macOS, Android, iOS)
‚Ä¢ Professional working proficiency in English

Experience You Should Definitely Brag About:
‚Ä¢ Certifications in Azure, AWS, or DevOps-related fields
‚Ä¢ Experience with package managers, data management and optimized retrieval
‚Ä¢ Familiar with agile development workflows and Jira
‚Ä¢ Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack
‚Ä¢ Experience working with a global team
‚Ä¢ French and English language skills

Benefits and Other Cool Stuff:
Our employees enjoy a robust benefit package, health coverage, bonus potential, exceptional paid time
off and holidays, and parental leave. Not to mention, the cool perks you get as a ‚ÄúTechsoftian‚Äù ‚Ä¶ fun
culture, a relaxed and inclusive environment, awesome leadership, continuous learning, flexibility in
your daily schedule, charitable donation matching program, home office reimbursement program (and
monthly internet), an amazing employee recognition program (winners get an all-expense trip to
somewhere in the World!) and an authentic workplace where you can truly be yourself. The salary range
for this role depends on experience. The pay range for an individual located in France is ‚Ç¨55,000 ‚Äì
‚Ç¨60,000/year.

Tech Soft 3D proudly celebrates and is committed to diversity and inclusion. Check out our CEO‚Äôs Pledge
to advance and support D&I in the workplace here.

‚ÄúYou almost can‚Äôt walk down the street and see a man-made thing that somehow hasn‚Äôt been touched by Tech
Soft 3D technology. That makes me feel great.‚Äù Ron Fritz, CEO

Check out our people here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HAgB3OW1WsM

What are you waiting for? Apply now!

title: Devops Engineer - Nantes
description:
What makes us Qlik?

A Gartner¬Æ Magic Quadrant‚Ñ¢ Leader for 15 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.

We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.

The DevOps Engineer Role

Join Qlik‚Äôs Software Factory team as a DevOps Engineer, and help build the future of DevOps in a Data & AI world ! You will play a pivotal role in growing the DevOps culture at Qlik, as well as designing advanced pipeline systems enabling our R&D teams to efficiently develop, test, and deliver new features to Qlik customers.

Your work will be instrumental in managing and maintaining our strategic Qlik SaaS service pipeline, automating service releases, evangelizing best practices, and ensuring a smooth developer experience from idea to code in production.

What makes this role interesting?

Innovative Environment: Engage with cutting-edge technologies to build and operate CI/CD solutions, using the latest tools in the AWS environment.

End-to-End Ownership: Be part of a critical team that owns and automates the entire service release process, ensuring velocity and reliability.

Collaborative Projects: Work closely with development and transversal teams to create innovative pipeline systems and DevOps processes, contributing to the overall delivery performance of the organization.

Exciting Challenges: Participate in designing new internal solutions & processes, as well as running POCs on innovative tools and solutions, driving forward our technological capabilities.

Balanced Work Life: We believe in, and support, a healthy work-life balance by enabling work from home as well as working in the office. Each team member can play to their strengths, while at the same time being part of, learning from, and enjoying being part of a team.

Here‚Äôs how you‚Äôll be making an impact:

CI/CD Expertise: Design and build robust CI/CD solutions for our SaaS product in an AWS environment, streamlining the development, integration and deployment processes.

Change Management: Help grow the DevOps culture at Qlik and drive change at scale. Ensure improvements are data-driven and user-focused.

Collaboration and Support: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Architecture, Platforms, and Domains, to deliver first-rate solutions and processes, supporting the R&D organization with expert guidance.

Problem Solving: Sharpen your analytical skills and solve complex problems, ensure our development teams are getting the best Developer Experience.

We‚Äôre looking for a teammate with:
‚Ä¢ 2+ years well-documented experience as DevOps Engineer/Software Developer/SRE.
‚Ä¢ Good analytical skills for solving complex problems and identifying broad perspectives for potential solutions.
‚Ä¢ Experience building microservices or at least a solid understanding of the principles of the microservice architecture.
‚Ä¢ Experience delivering enterprise cloud SaaS solutions based on AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
‚Ä¢ Understanding containerization and deployment on Linux using technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes and Helm.
‚Ä¢ Strong passion for quality and customer success.
‚Ä¢ Willingness to work with geographically distributed teams across various time zones.
‚Ä¢ Experience with any of the following would be a plus: GoLang, ArgoCD, GitHub/GitHub Actions/GitHub API, Prometheus/Grafana.

The location for this role is:

Nantes, France (remote friendly)

Apply now and help change how the world transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights and turns complex data challenges into new opportunities!

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our Careers Page.

What else do we offer?

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra ‚Äúchange the world‚Äù day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs

title: Senior AWS DevOps Engineer
description:
MetaWealth is a WEB3 investment platform, that tokenizes real estate assets through blockchain technology, transforming physical properties into digital tokens representing ownership stakes. This approach lowers the entry threshold for investors and enhances transparency, security, and efficiency by leveraging smart contracts and decentralized finance (DeFi) mechanisms.

At MetaWealth, we are passionate about empowering retail investors to take control of their financial future. We believe that everyone should have access to investment opportunities that can help them grow their wealth and generate passive income, regardless of their investment experience or the amount of capital they have to invest.We are looking for a Mobile Engineer to join our team.

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team and help build, scale, and optimize our cloud infrastructure. You will play a key role in managing CI/CD workflows, automating infrastructure, and ensuring system reliability. This role requires experience in AWS, Terraform, Docker, and GitHub Actions, with a strong focus on monitoring, logging, and maintaining smooth operations.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines for efficient software deployment
‚Ä¢ Automate and manage
‚Ä¢ Infrastructure as code using Terraform and Ansible
‚Ä¢ Configure and maintain monitoring systems using Datadog and CloudWatchContinuously monitor system health, performance, and security
‚Ä¢ Create infrastructure diagrams and documentation to improve visibility and maintainability
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and optimise cloud services, ensuring high availability and scalability

Tech Stack
‚Ä¢ Cloud & Infrastructure: AWS
‚Ä¢ Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Ansible
‚Ä¢ Containerisation & Orchestration: Docker, ECS
‚Ä¢ CI/CD: GitHub Actions
‚Ä¢ Monitoring & Logging: Datadog, AWS CloudWatch

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in a DevOps, SRE, or Cloud Engineer role
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, ECS, ECR, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Exposure to Kubernetes and container orchestration
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Terraform for infrastructure automation
‚Ä¢ Experience managing CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions
‚Ä¢ Scripting skills (Bash or Python) for automation
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools (Datadog, CloudWatch)
‚Ä¢ Ability to troubleshoot networking, performance, and deployment issues
‚Ä¢ Strong documentation skills for infra diagrams and process documentation

Nice to Have
‚Ä¢ Experience optimising cloud costs and managing AWS budgets
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of CloudFormation or AWS CDK

title: DevOps Engineer (M/W)
description:
Job Description

Your job

1. Migration to Jenkins:
‚Ä¢ Pipeline Migration: Lead the migration of our existing Azure DevOps pipelines to Jenkins, ensuring that the transition is smooth and efficient.
‚Ä¢ Jenkins Setup: Design, build, and maintain Jenkins pipelines to support continuous integration and continuous delivery.
‚Ä¢ Security & Code Quality Integration: Integrate SonarQube and Checkmarx into Jenkins pipelines for static code analysis and security checks.

2. Release Automation & XLRelease Integration:
‚Ä¢ Automate Release Workflows: Leverage XLRelease to automate the deployment process, integrating ServiceNow for ticket creation and workflow automation within the release cycle.
‚Ä¢ Versioning and Tagging: Ensure proper version control and tagging throughout the release process.

3. Migration to OpenShift & Cloud Infrastructure:
‚Ä¢ Cloud Migration: Manage the migration of applications to OpenShift, setting up Kubernetes clusters and integrating Consul for service discovery.
‚Ä¢ Failover and High Availability: Enhance the failover processes with dev team to ensure a robust primary-backup system for high availability and disaster recovery.

4. Testing and Monitoring:
‚Ä¢ Automate Integration Testing: Collaborate with the development team to automate integration tests, ensuring seamless integration into the Jenkins pipelines.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Python Development Support (Remote/Hybrid)
description:
Requisition #: 15398

Ansys is now a part of Synopsys. Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq: SNPS) accelerates technology innovation from silicon to systems. Catalyzing the era of pervasive intelligence, we deliver design solutions, from electronic design automation to silicon IP, to system design and multiphysics simulation and analysis. We partner closely with our customers across a wide range of industries to maximize their R&D capability and productivity, powering innovation today that ignites the ingenuity of tomorrow. Learn more at www.synopsys.com.

When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys.

Summary / Role Purpose

The Senior DevOps Engineer is responsible for the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Senior DevOps Engineer will use advanced technical and problem-solving skills to design, develop, and deploy software applications for on-prem and cloud platforms using containerization technologies.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Participates in planning, architecture, and research around on-prem and cloud deployments.
‚Ä¢ Performs complex development activities that may require extensive analysis in areas including user experience, software design and solver research.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with software engineering teams to design and create efficient, scalable, and maintainable containerized software solutions for on-prem and cloud deployments.
‚Ä¢ Support development teams with scripting and automation tasks, primarily using Python, to enhance development workflows and system integration.
‚Ä¢ Implement cloud deployment strategies using Kubernetes based environments, ensuring high availability, scalability, and security of applications.
‚Ä¢ Monitor and troubleshoot cloud-based containerized applications, addressing performance issues and ensuring system stability.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with DevOps teams to implement CI/CD pipelines and streamline software release cycles in on-prem and cloud environments with Kubernetes.
‚Ä¢ Works independently with minimal supervision and may take on some planning and mentoring responsibilities.
‚Ä¢ May be responsible for managing interns or co-ops but typically does not have direct reports.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience
‚Ä¢ BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Quantitative Sciences with at least 5 years of commercial experience in software development using object-oriented languages like Python or command languages like Bash.
‚Ä¢ Commercial experience with Docker images creation and optimization.
‚Ä¢ Experience deploying and managing containerized applications in on-prem and/or cloud environments using Kubernetes.

Preferred Qualifications and Skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent technical knowledge and commercial experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
‚Ä¢ Experience delivering pipelines in environments such as GitHub Enterprise Cloud, Azure DevOps Server and Services.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in cloud and on-prem environments.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with reverse proxies, load balancers and API gateway tools, as well as with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
‚Ä¢ Certifications in relevant cloud technologies such as AWS Certified Developer, Azure Developer Associate, or Google Cloud Certified.
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.

At Ansys, we know that changing the world takes vision, skill, and each other. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired. Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement.

Our Commitments:
‚Ä¢ Amaze with innovative products and solutions
‚Ä¢ Make our customers incredibly successful
‚Ä¢ Act with integrity
‚Ä¢ Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper

Our Values:
‚Ä¢ Adaptability: Be open, welcome what‚Äôs next
‚Ä¢ Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately
‚Ä¢ Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve
‚Ä¢ Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger

Our Actions:
‚Ä¢ We commit to audacious goals
‚Ä¢ We work seamlessly as a team
‚Ä¢ We demonstrate mastery
‚Ä¢ We deliver outstanding results

OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE
We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive.

TAKE A LEAP OF CERTAINTY IN YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS

At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high ‚Äì met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at a lower cost.

At Ansys, it‚Äôs about the learning, the discovery, and the collaboration. It‚Äôs about the ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next‚Äù as much as the ‚Äúmission accomplished.‚Äù And it‚Äôs about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy, and ethics.

CREATING A PLACE WE‚ÄôRE PROUD TO BE
Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following more recent awards, although our list goes on: America‚Äôs Most Loved Workplaces, Gold Stevie Award Winner, America‚Äôs Most Responsible Companies, Fast Company World Changing Ideas, Great Place to Work Certified (China, Greece, France, India, Japan, Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, U.K.).

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Lead Application Engineer - DevOps Engineering Lead F/M
description:
Requisition #: 16991

Ansys is now a part of Synopsys. Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq: SNPS) accelerates technology innovation from silicon to systems. Catalyzing the era of pervasive intelligence, we deliver design solutions, from electronic design automation to silicon IP, to system design and multiphysics simulation and analysis. We partner closely with our customers across a wide range of industries to maximize their R&D capability and productivity, powering innovation today that ignites the ingenuity of tomorrow. Learn more at www.synopsys.com.

Summary / Role Purpose

As Ansys Lead Application Engineer, you will work with a variety of customers in your application area of cloud/HPC Simulation vertical deployment and become a credible advisor for improving your customers' product development.

You will lead technical efforts in vertical application deployment, focusing on the scalability, robustness and performance of our developed solutions. Working at the intersection of IT infrastructure and development, you will play a role in shaping the success of deploying our technology in real-world environments in various industries and guide other team members in scaling our solutions.

This includes owning the design and execution of stress tests, refining deployment templates, and establishing best practices for containerization, Kubernetes orchestration, and CI/CD integration. Your leadership will ensure that our solutions are production-ready and can scale with confidence across diverse IT environments.

You will lead technical sales support activities and work with sales leaders to plan our go-to-market strategy for selected customers. You will scope or lead the delivery of professional services projects, provide customer consulting and help translate customer requirements into new product features.

You will take the lead in multidisciplinary teams to develop end-to-end simulation solutions and help expand our application areas and industry knowledge. By sharing your knowledge and experience within Ansys teams and with customers, you will enhance your reputation and become a sought-after person in your field of application.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Provide proactive and results-oriented leadership in the planning, coordination and execution of all technical activities throughout the lifecycle of a sales opportunity, such as technical discovery, negotiation of technical success criteria, product presentations, demonstrations and evaluations. Works independently, responsibly, across teams and organizations.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Sales to drive the most competitive technical assignments to successful outcomes by leveraging your recognized thought leadership and expertise in the relevant application area.
‚Ä¢ Interact with customers to understand their key business initiatives, product development needs and design workflows; analyze how Ansys products and platforms can meet and exceed the customer's goals and improve their key performance indicators; communicate the Ansys value proposition to senior management.
‚Ä¢ Leading project teams to develop differentiated but reusable simulation solutions using the Ansys platform and products, deploying these solutions in customers' design workflows.
‚Ä¢ Support for knowledge sharing and mentoring programs within Ansys.
‚Ä¢ Work with Ansys product development teams to define the Ansys product roadmap; lead project teams testing new versions of Ansys products on industrial problems, develop best practices for applications.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate leadership and active engagement in Ansys initiatives to innovate offerings and solutions, improve technology and productivity, and develop people.
‚Ä¢ Support the Ansys Field and Digital Marketing team by developing promotional materials and supporting events as well as writing and delivering conference presentations.
‚Ä¢ Leading the delivery of professional services, providing customer consulting.
‚Ä¢ Lead the design, implementation, and optimization of scalable, secure, and high-performing deployment architectures using Kubernetes and container technologies, including conducting performance and scalability testing of vertical applications and proactively identifying and resolving system bottlenecks.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to architecture decisions and strategic planning, ensuring our deployment frameworks and platform scalability align with emerging trends and advancements in cloud infrastructure, DevOps, and deployment automation.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience
‚Ä¢ Required education and degree type: BS or MS or PhD in Mechanical/Chemical/Aerospace/Electrical Engineering or related field
‚Ä¢ Required minimum years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+8, MS+6, or PhD+3
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated use of relevant Ansys software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA, PLM software packages
‚Ä¢ Subject matter expert in one or more relevant disciplines within Ansys‚Äô business and is/will be sought out for advice by other Ansys engineers
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated understanding of engineering practices and product development, experience with building solutions using simulation technology and deploying those solutions within customers‚Äô engineering workflows
‚Ä¢ Track record of delivering exceptional customer outcomes and revenue impact
‚Ä¢ Strong leadership and mentoring skills
‚Ä¢ Logical problem-solving, strong interpersonal and communication skills, fluent in writing and speaking English
‚Ä¢ Ability to organize and manage multiple projects which are complex in nature, possesses a sense of urgency
‚Ä¢ Projects a professional image and demonstrates business acumen, driven to succeed
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel domestically up to 25% of time
‚Ä¢ Proven experience (5+ years) in leading application deployments in production environments.
‚Ä¢ Expertise with Kubernetes and container orchestration in large-scale deployments
‚Ä¢ Expertise with multiple DevOps pipelines tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins) and Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Pulumi)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in performance testing, scalability analysis, and tuning of distributed systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with monitoring and observability stacks (Grafana, OpenTelemetry)
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and hybrid/multi-cloud architectures
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Python scripting, particularly using simulation software APIs and associated simulation related automation tools

Preferred Qualifications and Skills
‚Ä¢ Preferred education and years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+12, MS+10, or PhD+7
‚Ä¢ 4 years of experience in application engineering, customer support, or consulting services type customer facing roles using engineering software
‚Ä¢ Ability to interact effectively with senior business managers and C-level executives
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel domestically up to 50% of time
‚Ä¢ Basic understanding of programming languages such as: C# (.NET), Javascript, HTML,
‚Ä¢ Practical knowledge of agility and agile project management

#LI-Hybrid

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

At Ansys, part of Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

title: Site Reliability Engineer - EMEA Remote
description:
Description

Here at Hugging Face, we‚Äôre on a journey to advance good Machine Learning and make it more accessible. Along the way, we contribute to the development of technology for the better.

We have built the fastest-growing, open-source, library of pre-trained models in the world. With more than 500K+ models and 250K+ stars on GitHub, over 15.000 companies are using HF technology in production, including leading AI organizations such as Google, Elastic, Salesforce, Algolia, and Grammarly.

About the role:

We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer responsible for maintaining and scaling our product infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have experience maintaining large infrastructure for AI workflows and strong experience supporting teams to create best practices for reliability and scalability.

Responsabilities:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, deploy, and maintain reliable and scalable infrastructure.
‚Ä¢ Manage large Kubernetes clusters.
‚Ä¢ Measure and optimize system performance.
‚Ä¢ Patch infrastructure to avoid vulnerabilities.
‚Ä¢ Keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite outages and configuration errors.
‚Ä¢ Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple teams.

Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of experience in a Site Reliability Engineer or Infrastructure Engineer role.
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of cloud providers such as AWS, GCP, infra-as-code frameworks and observability tools.
‚Ä¢ Strong communication, collaboration, and documentation skills.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Linux, Git, containers, networking and command line tools.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate and communicate asynchronously.

About you:

If you are a passionate Site Reliability Engineer with a keen interest in AI and thrive in a challenging and innovative setting, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies while working alongside talented professionals in a collaborative and stimulating environment.

More about Hugging Face

We are actively working to build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusivity. We are intentionally building a workplace where people feel respected and supported‚Äîregardless of who you are or where you come from. We believe this is foundational to building a great company and community. Hugging Face is an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We value development. You will work with some of the smartest people in our industry. We are an organization that has a bias for impact and is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.

We care about your well-being. We offer flexible working hours and remote options. We offer health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer parental leave and flexible paid time off.

We support our employees wherever they are. While we have office spaces in NYC and Paris, we're very distributed and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices. If needed, we'll also outfit your workstation to ensure you succeed.

We want our teammates to be shareholders. All employees have company equity as part of their compensation package. If we succeed in becoming a category-defining platform in machine learning and artificial intelligence, everyone enjoys the upside.

We support the community. We believe major scientific advancements are the result of collaboration across the field. Join a community supporting the ML/AI community.

title: Software Engineer - Backend
description:
Who we are

Helsing is a defence AI company. Our mission is to protect our democracies. We aim to achieve technological leadership, so that open societies can continue to make sovereign decisions and control their ethical standards.

As democracies, we believe we have a special responsibility to be thoughtful about the development and deployment of powerful technologies like AI. We take this responsibility seriously.

We are an ambitious and committed team of engineers, AI specialists and customer-facing programme managers. We are looking for mission-driven people to join our European teams - and apply their skills to solve the most complex and impactful problems. We embrace an open and transparent culture that welcomes healthy debates on the use of technology in defence, its benefits, and its ethical implications.

The role

At Helsing we develop and deliver AI-based capabilities and the enabling infrastructure that allow semi-autonomous platforms to localise, navigate, and perceive the world in real time. We build software that is subject to significant and unorthodox technical constraints, must operate in a wide variety of constantly-changing environments, and has to support an ever-growing list of challenging use-cases. What we build ultimately ends up in the hands of real people in high-risk, high-stress situations, so must be both reliable and frictionless. Taken together, this brings a whole host of interesting engineering challenges across a wide variety of fields that you'll help us solve. To give some examples:
‚Ä¢ Distributed systems (e.g., intermittent connectivity and byzantine actors)
‚Ä¢ Embedded computing (e.g., resource-constrained compute and reverse-engineering)
‚Ä¢ Robotics (e.g., control systems and tasking)
‚Ä¢ Networking (e.g., long-range low-bandwidth radios and cross-medium routing)
‚Ä¢ Deployment infrastructure (e.g., air-gapped devices and heterogenous fleets)
‚Ä¢ Security (e.g., data sharing in low-trust, no-TLS networks and actually-secret data handling)
‚Ä¢ Machine learning (e.g., systems for model development, storage, and dissemination)
In several of these areas, we are working near the state-of-the-art; we actively read (and sometimes implement) research papers, and often need to push even further to make theory work in practice. In others, we are applying well-known techniques to real-world situations (with real-world limitations) that have never been used in before, which requires skill, diligence, and honing a deep understanding of the underlying technologies.
The day-to-day
‚Ä¢ Review code contributions, proposals, and RFCs from colleagues. At Helsing we strongly believe that unblocking others takes precedence over spending more time on your own work.
‚Ä¢ Propose and implement new features, capabilities, algorithms, infrastructure, or even full products across our stack. We encourage our engineers to look beyond their immediate team for missed opportunities, and to speak up when they identify one.
‚Ä¢ Become a mentor, find a mentee, and help support and develop our interviewing pipeline. The people make or break the company, and we want as many engineers as possible to be part of fostering and growing the organisation.
‚Ä¢ Share your experience and technical know-how with other Helsingers. We host tech talks, get together for smaller "let's learn together" groups, run topical office hours (e.g., on Rust), etc. to help each other get better with time.
‚Ä¢ Maintain our existing software stack, including working with internal and external customers to identify issues, improving operational reliability and performance, and fending off technical debt. The stack is a mix of Rust and Python, with Python mainly living in the ML-heavy sections.
‚Ä¢ Further develop our tests and benchmarks, both at the micro and macro level. We operate in a domain where robustness is of the utmost importance, and an extensive and ever-improving test suite is key to achieving that. And without thorough benchmarks, we would be flying blind.
‚Ä¢ Present your work at our weekly demo sessions. We want engineers to come together around what they are working on and to feel like they are not endlessly squirrelling away at something that doesn't matter. To that end, we host (and actively work towards) demo sessions that allow early feedback, celebration of progress, and a better shared understanding of everything that goes on at Helsing.
You should apply if you
‚Ä¢ Can write legible, maintainable, and performant code.
‚Ä¢ Communicate well in English, both verbally and in writing.
‚Ä¢ Enjoy collaborating with others, including reviewing code and pair programming.
‚Ä¢ Are comfortable working asynchronously (writing PRs and RFCs, having discussions by email).
‚Ä¢ Have backend development experience, ideally with a language like Rust, Java, Go, or C++.
‚Ä¢ Are familiar with backend interface tools like REST, GraphQL, gRPC/Protocol Buffers, and Arrow.
‚Ä¢ Strive to improve yourself, your peers, and the culture you work in over time.
‚Ä¢ Feel like ethical considerations are an inherent part of engineering.
Note: We operate at an intersection where women, as well as other minority groups, are systematically under-represented. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the listed qualifications; ability and impact cannot be summarised in a few bullet points.
Nice to have
‚Ä¢ Rust and Python specifically.
‚Ä¢ Container-based and cloud-native application architectures (e.g., Docker, Azure, AWS).
‚Ä¢ Metrics tooling (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
‚Ä¢ SQL and streaming database systems.
‚Ä¢ Routing protocols (e.g., IGP, BGP).
‚Ä¢ Cryptographic protocols (e.g., Signal, WireGuard).
‚Ä¢ Hardware interfaces (e.g., Arduino).
‚Ä¢ Robotics (e.g., control systems).
‚Ä¢ Production ML systems.
Join Helsing and work with world-leading experts in their fields
‚Ä¢ Helsing's work is important. You'll be directly contributing to the protection of democratic countries while balancing both ethical and geopolitical concerns.
‚Ä¢ The work is unique. We operate in a domain that has highly unusual technical requirements and constraints, and where robustness, safety, and ethical considerations are vital. You will face unique Engineering and AI challenges that make a meaningful impact in the world.
‚Ä¢ Our work frequently takes us right up to the state of the art in technical innovation, be it reinforcement learning, distributed systems, generative AI, or deployment infrastructure. The defence industry is entering the most exciting phase of the technological development curve. Advances in our field of world are not incremental: Helsing is part of, and often leading, historic leaps forward.
‚Ä¢ In our domain, success is a matter of order-of-magnitude improvements and novel capabilities. This means we take bets, aim high, and focus on big opportunities. Despite being a relatively young company, Helsing has already been selected for multiple significant government contracts.
‚Ä¢ We actively encourage healthy, proactive, and diverse debate internally about what we do and how we choose to do it. Teams and individual engineers are trusted (and encouraged) to practise responsible autonomy and critical thinking, and to focus on outcomes, not conformity. title: ABAKUS IT-Solutions - Cloud Engineer
description:
We're seeking a skilled and motivated Cloud Engineer to support a focused mission involving Azure infrastructure design and automation with TerraForm.

Key responsibilities

Deploy, configure, and manage Azure resources: virtual machines, networks, Storage, identities (Entra ID).

Build and maintain reusable TerraForm modules for infrastructure-as-code.

Enforce compliance policies using Azure Policy.

Optimize cloud performance and security.

Use Azure CLI for daily operations and automation tasks.

Collaborate with DevOps teams to integrate cloud services into CI/CD pipelines.

Contribute to technical documentation, internal training, and knowledge sharing.

Mandatory skills

Advanced experience with TerraForm and Azure CLI.

Proficiency in Linux systems (Debian, RHEL, Arch), Bash scripting, GIT, Docker, and SSH.

Hands-on experience with Ansible.

Deep understanding of network protocols: DNS, DHCP, VPN (especially Wireguard).

Proven ability to learn quickly, document effectively, and share knowledge.

Languages required

French: professional working proficiency

English: professional working proficiency

Profile:

Master's degree in a relevant field.

Recognized training or certifications in DevOps, Azure, or Cloud Engineering.

Strong analytical skills and a collaborative, knowledge-sharing mindset.

Why join us?

Work on a high-impact mission where your contributions directly shape cloud infrastructure.

Be part of a collaborative and tech-driven environment focused on automation and innovation.

Expand your expertise in Azure and Infrastructure-as-Code while working alongside passionate professionals.

Flexible and agile setup for a short yet rewarding freelance experience.
ABAKUS IT-SOLUTIONS, a dynamic IT services integrator founded in 1991, is growing and actively hiring to strengthen its talented team. We are a trusted partner in IT comfort, delivering tailored solutions to small and medium businesses as well as large enterprises across sectors such as public services, industry, and finance.

As experts in IT infrastructure management, we offer comprehensive services including personalized service desk support and IT solutions that span hardware, software, and cybersecurity. We take pride in our specialized knowledge of cloud technologies, IT consulting, and application development, with a focus on adapting to the latest innovations.

For larger organizations, we also provide top-tier IT expertise and resources through our staffing services, ensuring you have the right people for both operational and development projects. Additionally, we handle the deployment and installation of cutting-edge hardware, from servers to storage and personal computers, tailored to your needs.

At ABAKUS IT-SOLUTIONS, we are committed to fostering a workplace where employees thrive in an environment that values autonomy, innovation, and personal development. As we continue to grow, we are looking for skilled professionals who are ready to embrace new challenges and contribute to a team that is as passionate about IT as it is about creating comfort in every project we undertake.

Join us in shaping the future of IT! We offer exciting career opportunities across our offices in Belgium, Luxembourg, and Germany, along with the chance to work with a variety of high-profile clients in diverse industries. Ready to take the next step? Explore our open positions today!
